renderer

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderer.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a class for rendering a 3d scene to a buffered image.
    Author:
    Stephen Thompson ID: 300332215

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Renderer(int width, int height)
      Constructs a new Renderer object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(int width,
                int height)
        Constructs a new Renderer object. The new renderer object has a default camera named "default".
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the rendered image
        height - the height of the rendered image

    • Method Detail

        public boolean addModel(R_AbstractModel m)
        Adds a new model to the scene, returning false if a model with the same name already exists
        Parameters:
        m - the new model
        Returns:
        whether the model was successfully added or not

      • getModel

        public R_AbstractModel getModel(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the model with the name "name" in the scene
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the model with the name "name" or null if the model does not exist

        Returns:
        whether the model was successfully removed or not

      • setCamera

        public boolean setCamera(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the current camera used by the renderer to render the scene. Returns true if the camera is successfully set.
        Parameters:
        name - the camera's name
        Returns:
        boolean

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Changes the size of the render.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width of the render
        height - the new height of the render

      • setMap

        public void setMap(int[][] newShadowMap)

        Parameters:
        newShadowMap - the array representing the walls on the map
